Package aas_core.aas3_0.types.model

Interface ISubmodelElement

All Superinterfaces:
IClass, IHasDataSpecification, IHasExtensions, IHasSemantics, IQualifiable, IReferable
All Known Subinterfaces:
IAnnotatedRelationshipElement, IBasicEventElement, IBlob, ICapability, IDataElement, IEntity, IEventElement, IFile, IMultiLanguageProperty, IOperation, IProperty, IRange, IReferenceElement, IRelationshipElement, ISubmodelElementCollection, ISubmodelElementList
All Known Implementing Classes:
AnnotatedRelationshipElement, BasicEventElement, Blob, Capability, EnhancedAnnotatedRelationshipElement, EnhancedBasicEventElement, EnhancedBlob, EnhancedCapability, EnhancedEntity, EnhancedFile, EnhancedMultiLanguageProperty, EnhancedOperation, EnhancedProperty, EnhancedRange, EnhancedReferenceElement, EnhancedRelationshipElement, EnhancedSubmodelElementCollection, EnhancedSubmodelElementList, Entity, File, MultiLanguageProperty, Operation, Property, Range, ReferenceElement, RelationshipElement, SubmodelElementCollection, SubmodelElementList
public interface ISubmodelElement extends IReferable, IHasSemantics, IQualifiable, IHasDataSpecification
A submodel element is an element suitable for the description and differentiation of assets.

It is recommended to add a IHasSemantics.getSemanticId() to a submodel element.

Constraints:

  • Constraint AASd-129: If any Qualifier.getKind() value of IQualifiable.getQualifiers() (attribute qualifier inherited via Qualifiable) is equal to QualifierKind.TEMPLATE_QUALIFIER then the submodel element shall be part of a submodel template, i.e. a Submodel with Submodel.getKind() (attribute kind inherited via IHasKind) value is equal to ModellingKind.TEMPLATE.
